intro: [WRONG START] Illcecebrum linearifolium, commonly known as the threadleaf stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is known for its aromatic compounds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks. Its growth habit is prostrate, with stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground.
